basis: The user explicitly endorses an ultra-tiny, non-pressuring approach and signals tentative ability to perform one slow breath and a small sip of water, contingent on how they feel. They explicitly defer a bite and plan to check in after a meal, indicating alignment with the suggestion while retaining self-control and conditional commitment.
cognitive_dissonance: Conflicted between needing a flexible, no-pressure plan and the underlying anxiety about eating with anorexia nervosa. Desire to follow guidance conflicts with resistance to structured routines and fear that any bite could destabilize their pattern.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing tendencies (bite optional and loaded); worry that even small steps are insufficient or harmful; excessive self-judgment when deviating from a plan; perfectionistic belief that meals must be perfectly managed.
emotional_triggers: Irregular eating patterns, anxiety around eating due to anorexia nervosa, heat and environmental discomfort (Suwon weather), fear of losing control, desire to please the coach while protecting personal boundaries.
coaching_notes: Maintain ultra-tiny, non-pressuring guidance and validate the userâ€™s pacing. Emphasize self-compassion and permission to pause or skip bites. Encourage breathing and hydration as foundational rituals, with bite decisions left entirely up to their current felt sense. After meals, revisit goals with a focus on comfort, safety, and gradual adjustment, using check-ins to guide next steps.
